comment.author: 48982730@N00
comment._content: This appears to have been taken from the corner of Blue St and Miller St in North Sydney, overlooking Lavender Bay. The church on the right is St Francis Xavier, and is still there. Approximate shooting location: maps.google.com.au/maps?f=q&hl=en&geocode=&q=...

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: The boy with his model boat reminds me of a similar lad in the contemporary (1890) Arthur Streeton painting "From McMahon's Point - fare one penny" - artsearch.nga.gov.au/Detail-LRG.cfm?IRN=81092&View=LRG

comment.author: 51979177@N02
comment._content: Per this item, the roof appears to have been added to the Australia Hotel in April/May 1890 nla.gov.au/nla.news-article61231717 ('Political and Social Letter', para 5) ...this pic might have been taken a good few months prior to this...
